2.00.text: and one of the things I really find special about Easter is baking.

5.00.text: So I'm going to show you how to make hot cross buns.

7.61.text: The way I make them is slightly different.

9.80.text: So there's a special glaze that goes on them at the end

12.20.text: which just adds a little bit to that flavour.

14.20.text: To start with I've got some warm milk.

19.40.text: I've got some dried yeast.  I'm going to add the dried yeast to the milk.

23.80.text: Give that a stir, and a little sprinkle of sugar.

27.80.text: And that will help the yeast to really get going.

30.30.text: So while we're waiting for the yeast to get bubbly and frothy,

32.60.text: we're going to put the rest of the ingredients into this bowl.

35.87.text: I've got strong plain flour or bread flour.

38.60.text: Next I've got caster sugar and then some ground mixed spice.

42.00.text: I'm going to use nutmeg.  I tend to use whole nutmeg rather than ground.

46.00.text: I find the flavour's a lot better.

47.60.text: The smell already is really, really good.

49.60.text: And then I rub the butter through the flour

51.60.text: until we get a breadcrumb like texture.

53.80.text: And then we're going to add the liquid in.

55.80.text: So the yeast's gone all frothy and bubbly so we'll pour that straight in.

60.40.text: So now, using your hands, start working in the middle just to break the egg.

64.40.text: And then spin the bowl, more or less keeping your hand in the same place.

68.60.text: And just start working the flour into the liquid.

72.20.text: It will be sticky.  It'll be wet.

74.60.text: It'll be tacky.  That's exactly what you want.

77.56.text: One of the things that a lot of people do when they make bread

82.00.text: What that means is that your bread comes out quite heavy.

85.19.text: That's quite a sticky dough.  But that is what we're looking for.

88.80.text: So, at the moment, that still flows and will drop.

93.80.text: We're going to turn into a board and just knead it very gently.

97.00.text: Stretch. Fold. Give it a quarter of a turn.

100.60.text: Hold the back.  Stretch and fold.

103.40.text: Quarter of a turn.  And just keep doing that until it loses most of the stickiness.

109.40.text: We don't want to over work the dough.

111.40.text: If we start really kneading this now like we would for a bread,

114.00.text: we'd end up with quite a tough crumb.

115.80.text: You can see that's not sticking any more.

118.36.text: So now that's literally put into a bowl, covered with cling film or a damp tea towel,

122.80.text: and we'll leave it until it's doubled in size.

126.16.text: OK, so I've let the dough sit now for around 45 minutes.

130.20.text: Now we're going to knock this dough back.

131.99.text: The smell.  That's fantastic.  Straight away, it really hits you.

138.00.text: For the next part of this we're going to add the dried mixed fruit.

141.60.text: I've got quite a rich mix here.

143.79.text: I've got cherries in it, pineapple, raisins,

146.00.text: currants, sultanas, and a nice handful of mixed peel.

150.00.text: We're going to start by folding it over

153.00.text: And then we're going to bring the bottom up and over.

157.00.text: Just nip the ends.  So we just fold the fruit in.

161.60.text: Bring that side over. Bring that side over, and then turn over.

167.20.text: And then once the fruit's into the dough we're going to start kneading it.

171.00.text: Don't worry at first.  The fruit will fall out, that's fine.

173.60.text: Just keep mopping it up with the dough.

176.00.text: And for kneading this, hold the dough at the front,

178.63.text: pull it, push down with your fingers, and then where you've pushed that,

182.60.text: get the heel of your hand and push it through.

187.00.text: We need to do this for two to three minutes.

191.20.text: just press it and it should spring back slightly.

194.40.text: I'm going to cut this into 12 pieces, and now we're ready to shape each one

197.97.text: and get it onto the tray ready for proving.

200.00.text: The technique for rolling is to

202.00.text: place the palm of your hand over the piece of dough and start to rotate.

206.20.text: Gradually cup your hand and push your thumb and little finger together at the bottom.

211.20.text: And that just pushes the dough in and we get a nice ball of dough.

215.00.text: Once we've done that, what we're going to do now

217.20.text: is leave these to double in size.

219.20.text: Cover them with a bit of cling film,

221.00.text: and all I've done with this is rubbed a bit of butter.

223.64.text: You could use oil. Putting that bit of grease on helps it to stop sticking.

229.00.text: So the hot cross buns have been proving now for about 45 minutes.

233.00.text: Traditionally, these would have had pastry to form the cross on the top.

237.00.text: Nowadays we tend to make a quick paste.

239.40.text: So this is just plain flour and some water,

242.00.text: We're going to mix it to a smooth paste.

244.75.text: We're now going to transfer that into a piping bag,

246.80.text: and simply run the pastry straight across the top,

250.40.text: and then across in the opposite direction.

253.00.text: And now they're ready go in the oven.

254.20.text: So they'll go in the oven round about 15 minutes,

257.05.text: until they've risen, golden, and as soon as they come out we're going to put the glaze on them.

263.80.text: I mentioned earlier about the glaze that will go on these hot cross buns

266.40.text: which I think just changes them very slightly.

268.60.text: Just gives them a lot richer flavour, a lot nicer.

271.80.text: The ingredients we're going to use are butter, honey and cardamom pods.

276.00.text: They're really floral.  Got lovely, lovely flavour to them.

278.80.text: I've melted the butter on the hob.

281.31.text: I'm going to take the cardamom pods just in between two spoons

284.00.text: and just crush them and then drop that into the butter

289.20.text: And then we're going to add honey.  Stir that until the honey melts into the butter.

292.80.text: We're going to leave that to sit while the buns cook.

295.20.text: And as soon as they come out we use a pastry brush

297.52.text: and we'll get that brushed on the top.

300.56.text: Beautiful.  Absolutely spot-on. Really smells good.

305.60.text: Whilst they're still hot we need to get the topping on.

308.80.text: So there you have it.  That's my recipe for hot cross buns.

312.18.text:
The taste of these is so much better than
anything you could buy.
